intro: Hibbertia coriacea, commonly known as the rough-hairy hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with red veins, typically blooming in spring. Hibbertia coriacea is often found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
